src:
Hernando tras denunciar a Bravo: La lucha contra la corrupción tiene que ser despiadada
La diputada (PRSD) valoró la reacción el Presidente Piñera.
04 Nov 2019 by Yem Manríquez

Con información de Paulina García

La diputada Marcela Hernando (PRSD) se refirió a la denuncia que realizó en Fiscalía, contra la subsecretaria de Bienes Nacionales, Alejandra Bravo, razón que significó que el Presidente Sebastián Piñera le pidiera su renuncia.
"Me parece que es una muy buena reacción. La verdad es que es esperanzador que el Presidente haya dado un golpe tan rápido", expresó la diputada.
"La primera denuncia que me llegó tenía que ver con los viajes, demasiado asiduos a la región, y por otro lado no habían hechos más objetivos, hasta que me llegaron los WhatsApp, en que claramente se configuraba un delito, y por eso lo hice llegar de inmediato a la Fiscalía", sostuvo.
"Yo creo que no hay medias tintas. La lucha (contra la corrupción) tiene que ser despiadada", aseveró este lunes la parlamentaria.
text:
Hernando after denouncing Bravo: The fight against corruption has to be ruthless
The deputy (PRSD) appreciated the reaction President Piñera.
04 Nov 2019 by Yem Manríquez

With information from Paulina García

Deputy Marcela Hernando (PRSD) referred to the complaint she made in the Prosecutor's Office, against the Undersecretary of National Assets, Alejandra Bravo, which meant that President Sebastián Piñera asked him to resign.
"It seems to me that it is a very good reaction. The truth is that it is hopeful that the President has taken such a rapid blow," said the deputy.
"The first complaint that came to me had to do with the trips, too regulars to the region, and on the other hand they had not made any more objectives, until the WhatsApp arrived, in which a crime was clearly configured, and that's why I did it get to the Prosecutor's Office immediately, "he said.
"I think there are no half measures. The fight (against corruption) has to be ruthless," the parliamentarian said Monday.
